alert.note: Alert for Ben Hill; Berrien (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 17 at 6:18AM EST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Georgia, including the following counties, Ben Hill, Berrien, Colquitt, Cook, Irwin, Tift, Turner and Worth. * WHEN...Until 945 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 617 AM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Tifton, Ashburn, Sylvester, Ocilla, Adel, Moultrie, Nashville, Fitzgerald, Sparks, Enigma, Omega, Ray City, Norman Park, Lenox, Poulan, Doerun, Ty Ty, Alapaha, Phillipsburg and Unionville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
